title: About me
text:
Markus@Ljungqvist.xyz
PGP Key



About me
I am an quantitative analyst at Copenhagen Economics, where I help clients with quantitative analyses related to competition economics. I enjoy solving complex quantitative problems creatively, where I am able to leverage my in-depth knowledge of statistical programming languages.
Prior to joining Copenhagen Economics, I obtained Bachelor degrees in both Economics and European Studies, and a Masters degree in Economics from the University of Gothenburg. I specialize in applied microeconomics and econometrics, more specifically empirical industrial organization.

title: Software I Use
text: I use R professionally in my daily work, but I have also obtained advanced knowledge of R via an advanced course in R, personal projects, and reading various books from The Big Book of R

title: Software I Use
text:
Git
I am experienced using Git for professional, academic, and personal projects. I primarily use the Pro Git book for learning more about Git.

title: Software I Use
text:
LaTeX
My favorite markup language is LaTeX, which I use to make presentations and other types of documents.

title: Software I Use
text:
Markdown
For quick notes and short reports, I use Markdown, R Markdown, and quarto. The simple Markdown syntax enables quick typesetting, at the cost of the more advanced features from LaTex.

title: Software I Use
text:
Shell
I prefer to manage most things via the command line. When working on machines running windows, I use powershell. For Linux machines, I have experience with bash, fish, but currently use mksh
